Name: Installation of outdoor drinking fountains near entrances to parks under the jurisdiction of the department of parks and recreation.
Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the installation of outdoor drinking fountains near entrances to parks under the jurisdiction of the department of parks and recreation

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - March 7, 2024

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Parks and Recreation to install at least 50 outdoor drinking fountains in parks no later than June 1, 2035. Each fountain would have to be installed within 100 feet of an entrance to the park where it is located.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

      Section 1. Definitions. For purposes of this local law, the following terms have the following meanings: 
      Outdoor drinking fountain. The term "outdoor drinking fountain" means a plumbing fixture installed outside of a building or structure that allows a user to obtain a drink directly from a stream of flowing potable water without the use of any accessories.
      Park. The term "park" means a park under the jurisdiction of the department of parks and recreation.
      � 2. a. The commissioner of parks and recreation shall install no less than 50 outdoor drinking fountains in parks no later than June 1, 2035.
      b. Each outdoor drinking fountain installed pursuant to this section shall be located within 100 feet of an entrance to a park.
       � 3. This local law takes effect immediately.
